snippet: Infection control experts say many American hospitals have improperly trained their staffs to deal with Ebola patients because they were following federal guidelines that were too lax.
abstract: Infection control experts say many American hospitals have improperly trained their staffs to deal with Ebola patients because they were following federal guidelines that were too lax; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has issued stricter guidelines; photos and chart highlight changes from CDC and illustrate difficulties involved in removing protective gear safely.
lead_paragraph: Infection control experts say many American hospitals have improperly trained their staffs to deal with Ebola patients because they were following federal guidelines that were too lax.
